intro: Chrysosplenium macrostemon, commonly known as the broad-stemmed chrysosplenium, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Saxifragaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly succulent texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks, preferring cool, temperate climates. Chrysosplenium macrostemon is often found in the understory of forests, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
